intro: Minuartia ophiolitica, commonly known as the Ophiolite rock-cress, is a flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is a small, mat-forming perennial that typically grows in rocky or alpine environments. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers with four petals, typical of the mustard family. Its leaves are usually linear or lanceolate, and it is adapted to thrive in harsh, nutrient-poor soils. Minuartia ophiolitica is often found in regions with high altitudes and is a characteristic species of certain Mediterranean and Middle Eastern habitats.
